info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 1:37PM MST until January 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH SNOW AND SOME FREEZING DRIZZLE OVER THE PLAINS AND URBAN CORRIDOR THIS AFTERNOON... .Snow showers are expected to return to most areas and increase in coverage late this afternoon into this evening with some light freezing drizzle possible over the plains. Slick travel can be expected at times due to the snow and locally light ice accumulations for the evening commutes. Snow will taper off for the urban corridor and mountains by late evening, however will linger overnight across the northeast plains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Fort Collins, and Greeley. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely be slick and hazardous. Icy roads will make travel very difficult. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.
